intro: Ehretia janjalle, commonly known as the Indian snowball tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to the tropical regions of India and Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, rounded crown and showy, white, clustered flowers that appear in late winter to early spring. The plant has smooth, dark green leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible for some bird species. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to warm, humid climates.
